alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 9:36AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following county, Mendocino. * WHEN...Until 130 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 936 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ukiah, Fort Bragg, Willits, Point Arena, Laytonville, Albion, Ukiah Municipal Airport, Philo, Potter Valley, Boonville, Hopland, Rockport, Leggett, Gualala, Comptche, Navarro, Redwood Valley, Calpella, Branscomb and Talmage. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
